analysis.title: Clash of the Titans
analysis.author: Travis Beacham
analysis.logline: A demigod hero battles divine forces and a monstrous Leviathan to save a city, challenging the gods' control and proving humanity's potential for greatness.
analysis.tone: Epic, heroic, mythological with modern sensibilities

concept.justification: Brilliant reimagining of mythological hero's journey with fresh perspective on human/divine conflict

structure.justification: Tight three-act structure, clear progression, compelling narrative momentum

protagonist.justification: Perseus is complex, driven, with clear arc from uncertain youth to transformative hero

supporting_cast.justification: Rich ensemble with distinct voices and narrative purpose, especially Vidalia and Andromeda

dialogue.justification: Sophisticated, layered dialogue with mythic grandeur and contemporary wit

genre_execution.justification: Masterful blend of mythological spectacle with character-driven storytelling

originality.justification: Radical reimagining of mythic narrative, subverting divine/human power dynamics

major_weaknesses: Potentially complex mythology might challenge casual viewers
Dense world-building could overwhelm some audiences

target_audience.note: Broad appeal across fantasy, action, mythological genres

cast_attachability.note: Strong lead role, needs right charismatic actor

marketing_hook.note: Epic battles, divine conflict, heroic journey

structure_analysis.act_breaks: Inciting incident at Joppa, midpoint at Skolothia, climax battling Leviathan

characters.protagonist: Perseus - demigod hero seeking purpose, driven by compassion and heroic potential
characters.antagonist: Tiamat - cosmic deity seeking to overthrow divine order
supporting: Vidalia - dying earth goddess who inspires Perseus
Amoun - mysterious mentor with complex motivations

comparable_films.title: Clash of the Titans (2010)
comparable_films.similarity: Similar mythological premise, dramatically different execution

comparable_films.title: Wonder Woman
comparable_films.similarity: Mythic hero challenging divine status quo

budget_tier.justification: Extensive VFX, epic battle sequences, complex world-building

weaknesses: Complex mythology might challenge some viewers
assessment.recommendation_rationale: Exceptional screenplay with 8.70 weighted score, zero critical failures, and CVS of 16/18. Represents transformative mythological storytelling with breakthrough potential.

film_now_assessment.lightning_test: Opening mosaic sequence establishing mythic stakes and human potential
goosebumps_moments: Page 124-125: Andromeda's inspirational city rebuilding speech
film_now_assessment.career_risk_test: Absolutely. This screenplay represents a landmark reimagining of mythological storytelling.
film_now_assessment.legacy_potential: High - could become definitive modern myth adaptation

analysis.verdict_statement: FILM NOW: CLASH OF THE TITANS represents exceptional material that demands immediate greenlight consideration. The Lightning: A demigod hero challenges divine order through compassion and human potential. The Craft: Weighted score of 8.70 with no dimension below 8. The Commercial Case: CVS of 16/18. Chris Hemsworth or Tom Hardy as Perseus presents extraordinary star potential. Urgency: This screenplay will not remain available.
